definition: to sound like a broken record/to prattle/to nag/to mutter
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.chinese: 你在那边碎碎念什么啊？

sentences.english: My mother tends to chatter over little things.
sentences.chinese: 我妈妈总喜欢因为鸡毛蒜皮的小事碎碎念。

sentences.english: Don't be concerned about adult children any more, otherwise can not stop the annoying chatters.
sentences.chinese: 不要再替成年子女操心，才不会碎碎念。

sentences.english: Use Twitter to keep your fans in the loop.
sentences.chinese: 利用“碎碎念”来留住你朋友圈中的粉丝。

sentences.english: I don't like your nagging, please stop.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢你总是碎碎念，请不要这样。

definition: long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to be chattersome/to talk on and on without stopping/to nag
(coll.) to run off at the mouth/to jabber on
to talk about often/to reminisce about/to keep repeating/to keep harping on/to discuss
